content: The password for Gmail on one PC cannot be used on another PC. Google places a unique code for each account. You need to use you password you use online when setting up another PC, and Google uses that to confirm who you are and then places a unique code on that PC.

content:
1) questo è solo un forum di utenti, non un supporto tecnico (Thunderbird è software gratuito, non offre supporto tecnico)

2) Thunderbird è un software locale, non un servizio remoto. Se c'è un problema va risolto nella tua installazione di Thunderbird, nessuno può risolverlo "a distanza"

Informazioni utili da fornire:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

content:
There may be options here. Some hosting companies offer to do 100% transfer of the entire account when doing setup. I suggest a first approach would be to discuss the specifics of that with the new host, especially the email accounts. That would give you everything. Many hosts also allow a staging review so you can see the contents of the transfer prior to switching domain name to new host. That would give you the assurance you want and would require few changes changes in thunderbird, primarily the server setup to whatever the host specifies. Doing that may require using a more costly hosting company, but I encourage investigating this approach.

Or, you can move the account's email yourself:

Your email messages are stored on the hosting servers. Should you switch to another host, the messages would need to be moved. The safe way to do that has multiple steps - and can still have problems, not because of Thunderbird but because IMAP was designed for downloading messages, not uploading. Here are sample steps:

  1. check at account's synchronization&storage settings to verify that all desired folders can be downloaded
  2. then, click file>offline>download to ensure that you get all headers and content downloaded
  3. install the addon, importexporttools, if not already done
  4. highlight an account folder to transfer, such as inbox, rightclick, select importexporttool to export mbox - repeat for all folders
  5. now, reverse the process: highlight Local Folders, rightclick, select the importexporttools option to import mbox - repeat for all folders
  6. at this point, you have all the messages local to PC. For safety, I suggest backing up the profile at this point.
  7. now, set up accounts on the new host
  8. to upload the messages, I suggest creating a manual filter for the upload, as that automatically applies a slight delay on the process and increases the probability of uploading all messages intact. Afterwards, do a spot check.
creator: davidsk

content:
Globálna databáza je indexovací systém umožňujúcí Thunderbirdu vyhľadávať v zprávach. Znovuvytvorenie globálnej databázy preindexuje správy a vizitky z adresára. (Správy z konferencií nie sú indexované.)

Postup znovuvytvorenia globálnej databázy: - Ukončite Thunderbird. - Vyhľadajte vo svojom profile Thunderbirdu súbor global-messages-db.sqlite - Vymažte tento súbor. - Spustite Thunderbird. Automaticky sa začne proces vytvárania indexu. V závislosti na počte správ môže indexácia trvať dosť dlhý čas (cca 5 minút). Počas indexácie môžete Thunderbird používat, iba bude znížený jeho výkon a vyhľadávania prinesú iba čiastočné výsledky, alebo dokonca žiadne. Proces indexácie môžete sledovať v Správcovi aktivít (ponuka Nástroje > Správca činnosti).
creator: Ansamb

content:
Podľa mňa je celkom možné, že už máte preplnený priečinok "Doručená pošta" a možno aj "Odoslaná pošta", kde je Thunderbirdom stanovený maximálny objem 4GB (rovnako ako aj pre každý samostatný priečinok). Kliknite na priečinok "Doručená pošta" pravým tlačidlom myši, vyberte "Vlastnosti" a preverte akú veľkosť na disku zaberá. Limit veľkosti zložky je detailnejšie vysvetlený tuná: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Limits_%28Thunderbird%29#Folders_and_messages.

Odporúčam staré správy z preplneného priečinka "Doručená pošta" a "Odoslaná pošta" odstrániť, alebo archivovať. Postup archivácie: Označte všetku starú poštu v priečinku "Doručená pošta" (cca 1000 emailov) a zvoľte a (stlačiť klávesu a), alebo ich po označení archivujte aj takto (druhá možnosť): - Thunderbird - Správa - Archivovať - všetka stará pošta je ARCHIVOVANÁ - nájdete ju v priečinku ARCHÍVY pod konkrétnym letopočtom. Poštu z roku 2022 archivuje do priečinka 2022. Poštu z roku 2023 archivuje do priečinka 2023...atď https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/archivace-zprav

Pokiaľ v Thunderbirde odstránite e-mail, tak sa v skutočnosti iba označí ako odstránený, ale fyzicky zostane. Jeho fyzické odstránenie sa vykoná až použitím voľby "Údržba priečinkov“. Takže aby ste zmenšili veľkosť preplneného priečinka je nutné ešte vykonať "Údržbu priečinkov": https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/provedeni-udrzby-slozek. POSTUP: - Thunderbird - Súbor - Vykonať údržbu priečinkov http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/19/Thunderbird_udrzba_priecinkov.jpg

Ďalšou možnosťou je, že ste narazili na limit veľkosti niektorého iného priečinka, kde je maximálny limit tak isto 4GB. V tomto prípade pomôže to isté - uvoľniť preplnený priečinok archiváciou, alebo odstránením starých správ, a následným spustením "Údržby priečinkov".

content:
In thunderbird, the addressbook is separate from accounts. That is, deleting an account has no impact on the addressbook. You would lose the addressbook ONLY if the profile was also deleted, which is never recommended. A normal process would be to add the new account, then remove the old account. if the person helping you deleted everything prior to setting up the new account, then it's gone, but if the person decided to create a new profile, although not needed, the old profile may still be there. You can check this yourself:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' in left column and click 'open folder'
  3. you will now be in Windows File Explorer, click the back arrow once to position you at the 'Profiles' folder
  4. if you see more than one profile listed, click to review each of them. The addressbook's name is abook.sqlite. If the file in one profile is larger than in another profile, that is probably your old addressbook.
  5. you can retrieve it by clicking tools>import>import from a file. then click for addressbook and then click for sqlite file and then locate and se;ect the abook.sqlite file that you located.

content: please post screenshots of SMTP server for an account that works and this one. Also, click the account pane in account settings and check the bottom line that links to SMTP server to ensure that your account is using the correct SMTP server. A common problem when users have multiple accounts with same host is having two or more accounts accidentally attempting to use the same server. You have three accounts with that host, so you need to have three unique SMTP servers.

content:
I've lost my Thunderbird password.

There is no such thing as a "Thunderbird password". Thunderbird is an application run on your device, so it does not provide email addresses, nor the service to transmit emails. But Thunderbird can be used with your existing email address and service provider to send, receive, sort and search your email messages. Hence the password is needed for your email provider's server, and Thunderbird is just prompting you for it.

If you told Thunderbird to remember the password, it may be stored in the Thunderbird password manager, unless your email account uses OAuth2 authentication. In that case Thunderbird will only store an authentication token, and not the actual account password.

So you'd have to check with your email provider about password reset options.

content:
Here is what I respond when asked how to transfer from one PC to another. I think it may apply here IF you have located the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder. If you do NOT have the thunderbird folder, let me know and I'll provide other steps.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
How did you move the account? Is the old device still available? In moving, you may have omitted some components. Here are my normal steps:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key

  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
